column4: can anyone tell me how to remove my home icon on ubuntu? http://img300.imageshack.us/img300/3963/screenshotaac.png
can anyone tell me how to remove my home icon on ubuntu? http://img300.imageshack.us/img300/3963/screenshotaac.png
sudo chmod 750 /path/to/file; sudo chown $USER /path/to/file
if its a folder put -R after the word chmod and chown
are you running winrar?
just spotted it in your screenshow
linux has a native rar handler
Okay so how would i go about removing the icon off my desktop?
which icon exactly?
home folder
try this: sudo chmod -R 750 /home/$USER; sudo chown -R $USER /home/$USER
that command is to remove just the icon off my desktop?
no it will make sure you have correct access to your own data
if you look in ~/Desktop you may see the icon, the fact that the permissions are bad isnt great
chmod: cannot access `/home/shivam/.gvfs': Permission denied
did you use sudo? you can copy / paste to the terminal which is why I gave the full command
yes i used sudo
your home folder permissions are all out of whack, probably because gui apps have been run with sudo
what do you suggest?
reboot to root recovery console and do the same command there but use the actual user name
will do, thanks
